intro: Taraxacum hilare, commonly known as the dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by the formation of fluffy white seed heads. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are usually hairy and toothed. It is a perennial herb that thrives in a variety of soil types and is commonly found in lawns and meadows. The milky sap of the plant contains latex, which can cause skin irritation in some individuals.
